pyxalign.data_structures.positions.rotate_positions(positions: ndarray, angle: float, center: ndarray, new_center: ndarray | None = None) → ndarray[source]

Rotates an array of 2D positions by a given angle in degrees.

Parameters:

  • positions (np.ndarray) – An Nx2 array where each row represents a point [x, y].

  • angle (float) – The rotation angle in degrees.

Returns:

The rotated Nx2 array of positions.

Return type:

np.ndarray

pyxalign.data_structures.positions.shear_positions(positions: ndarray, angle: float, center: ndarray, axis: int = 1) → ndarray[source]

Apply a shear transformation to a 2D vector of positions using a shear angle.

Parameters:

  • positions (np.ndarray) – Array of shape (N, 2) where each row is a position [x, y].

  • angle (float) – The shear angle in degrees.

  • axis (int) – The axis along which to apply the shear.

Returns:

Array of sheared positions.

Return type:

np.ndarray
